alert.note: Alert for Coastal Flagler; Coastal St. Johns; Inland St. Johns (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 5:58PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Flagler and southeastern St. Johns Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 558 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Crescent Beach, or 9 miles south of Saint Augustine, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Marineland, Saint Augustine Shores, Butler Beach, Crescent Beach and Dupont Center. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Flagler; Coastal St. Johns; Inland St. Johns
